definitions: To blow air on something or someone, typically with a fan or similar object, to cool or move air.
To spread out or cause to spread out in the shape of a fan.
To strike out in baseball (of a batter) or to cause to strike out (of a pitcher).
examples: She was fanning herself with a magazine.
The cards were fanning out across the table.
The pitcher was fanning the batters with his fastball.
